Package mvc.model

Interface StockManager

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    BetterStockManager
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvancedStockManager, SimpleStockManager
    public interface StockManager
    The mvc.model.StockManager interface represents operations on stocks and is the interface that houses the methods for the model of this application. Changes since P1: The portfolio manager class was redundant and methods from that class were added to the StockManager interface (i.e. addPortfolio, removePortfolio, findValue, etc...). The old PortfolioManager class was removed and its methods were added to the SimpleStockManager implementation as needed. Now all the functionality of the program is encapsulated in the model without the need of an external class for methods on portfolios

      The getCrossovers method returns the days that are x-day crossovers for a specified stock over a specified date range and x-value.

      • addPortfolio

        void addPortfolio​(java.lang.String name)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The addPortfolio method allows a user to add a portfolio with a given name to the PortfolioManager. Adding a portfolio with a name that already exists is not allowed.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the name already exists

      • removePortfolio

        void removePortfolio​(java.lang.String name)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        The removePortfolio method removes a portfolio of the given name from the portfolio manger.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given portfolio is not found

      • adjustPortfolio

        void adjustPortfolio​(java.lang.String name,
                     java.lang.String ticker,
                     double shares)
        The adjustPortfolio method supports the addition and subtraction of stock from a single portfolio. If a stock is already found in a portfolio, that stock will be updated. Otherwise, a new stock with a given number of shares will be added to the portfolio. If the number of shares of a certain stock reaches 0, that stock will be removed from the portfolio. No stock may have negative shares.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the portfolio
        ticker - the stock ticker
        shares - the number of shares to be added

      • getPortfolioValue

        double getPortfolioValue​(java.lang.String name,
                         java.time.LocalDate date)
        The getPortfolioValue method returns the total value of a portfolio of the given name on the given date.
        Parameters:

        date - the given date
        Returns:
        the double value
